t: Jeremiah 46
Judgment on Egypt
The*p word of the Lord*s which came to Jeremiah the prophet against the nations.

Against Egypt. Concerning*p the army of Pharaoh Necho, king of Egypt, which was by the River Euphrates in Carchemish, and which Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon defeated in the fourth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah:
“Order*pn the buckler and shield, And*ld draw near to battle!
Harness*ld the horses, And*ld mount up, you horsemen! Stand*ld forth with your*i helmets, Polish*ld the spears, Put*ld on the armor!
Why*ld have I seen them dismayed and*i turned back? Their*ld mighty ones are beaten down; They*ld have speedily fled, And*ld did not look back, For*ild fear was*i all around,” says the Lord.*s
“Do*ld not let the swift flee away, Nor*ld the mighty man escape; They*ld will stumble and fall Toward*ld the north, by the River Euphrates.
“Who*ln is*i this coming up like a flood, Whose*ld waters move like the rivers?
Egypt*ld rises up like a flood, And*ld its*i waters move like the rivers; And*ld he says, ‘I will go up and*i cover the earth, I*ld will destroy the city and its inhabitants.’
Come*ld up, O horses, and rage, O chariots! And*ld let the mighty men come forth: The*ld Ethiopians and the Libyans who handle the shield, And*ld the Lydians who handle and*i bend the bow.

For*ld this is*i the day of the Lord God*s of hosts, A*ld day of vengeance, That*ld He may avenge Himself on His adversaries. The*ld sword shall devour; It*ld shall be satiated and made drunk with their blood; For*ld the Lord God*s of hosts has a sacrifice In*ld the north country by the River Euphrates.
“Go*ln up to Gilead and take balm, O*ld virgin, the daughter of Egypt; In*ld vain you will use many medicines; You*ld shall not be cured.
The*ld nations have heard of your shame, And*ld your cry has filled the land; For*ld the mighty man has stumbled against the mighty; They*ld both have fallen together.”
Babylonia Will Strike Egypt
The*p word that the Lord*s spoke to Jeremiah the prophet, how Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon would come and*i strike the land of Egypt.
“Declare*pn in Egypt, and proclaim in Migdol; Proclaim*ld in Noph and in Tahpanhes; Say,*ld ‘Stand fast and prepare yourselves, For*ld the sword devours all around you.’
Why*ld are your valiant men*i swept away? They*ld did not stand Because*ld the Lord*s drove them away.
He*ld made many fall; Yes,*ld one fell upon another. And*ld they said, ‘Arise! Let*ld us go back to our own people And*ld to the land of our nativity From*ld the oppressing sword.’
They*ld cried there, ‘Pharaoh,*ld king of Egypt, is*i but*i a noise. He*ld has passed by the appointed time!’
“As*iln I live,” says the King, Whose*ld name is*i the Lord*s of hosts, “Surely*ld as Tabor is*i among the mountains And*ld as Carmel by the sea, so*i he shall come.
O*ld you daughter dwelling in Egypt, Prepare*ld yourself to go into captivity! For*ld Noph shall be waste and desolate, without inhabitant.
“Egypt*ln is*i a very pretty heifer, But*ild destruction comes, it comes from the north.

Also*ld her mercenaries are in her midst like fat bulls, For*ld they also are turned back, They*ld have fled away together. They*ld did not stand, For*ld the day of their calamity had come upon them, The*ld time of their punishment.
Her*ld noise shall go like a serpent, For*ld they shall march with an army And*ld come against her with axes, Like*ld those who chop wood.
“They*ln shall cut down her forest,” says the Lord,*s “Though*ld it cannot be searched, Because*ld they are*i innumerable, And*ld more numerous than grasshoppers.
The*ld daughter of Egypt shall be ashamed; She*ld shall be delivered into the hand Of*ld the people of the north.”
The*p Lord*s of hosts, the God of Israel, says: “Behold, I will bring punishment on Amon of No, and Pharaoh and Egypt, with their gods and their kings—Pharaoh and those who trust in him.

And I will deliver them into the hand of those who seek their lives, into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon and the hand of his servants. Afterward it shall be inhabited as in the days of old,” says the Lord.*s
God Will Preserve Israel

“But*pn do not fear, O My servant Jacob, And*ld do not be dismayed, O Israel! For*ld behold, I will save you from afar, And*ld your offspring from the land of their captivity; Jacob*ld shall return, have rest and be at ease; No*ld one shall make him*i afraid.

Do*ld not fear, O Jacob My servant,” says the Lord,*s “For*ld I am*i with you; For*ld I will make a complete end of all the nations To*ld which I have driven you, But*ld I will not make a complete end of you. I*ld will rightly correct you, For*ld I will not leave you wholly unpunished.”
